caption_en: Nose Wheel Steering System ( ) The Learjet 45 nose wheel steering system enables the pilot to maneuver the airplane on the ground.

title: The digital nose wheel steering system is a steer- by-wire s…
caption_en: The digital nose wheel steering system is a steer- by-wire system. It provides a nose wheel deflection of up to This steering authority depends on the ground speed and rudder pedal inputs by the crew.

title: The system consists of 4 rudder pedal force transducers 2 pe…
caption_en: The system consists of 4 rudder pedal force transducers 2 per pilot), a nose wheel steering computer, steering servo actuator and gearbox.

title: The rudder pedals have 2 sets of stops. The primary stop is …
caption_en: The rudder pedals have 2 sets of stops. The primary stop is where the rudder reaches its physical stop. This gives a nose deflection

title: The steering computer is powered by the DC Left ESS bus. It …
caption_en: The steering computer is powered by the DC Left ESS bus. It uses the wheel speeds from the 4 main wheel transducers in computing nose wheel deflection. As the ground speed increases, the deflection decreases. These deflections decrease to 0 at 80 knots.

title: The steering actuator gearbox is located on top of the nose …

title: Operation The system is armed when the NOSE STEER switch is …
caption_en: Operation The system is armed when the NOSE STEER switch is selected on. An ON light illuminates on the switch. During slow taxy, deflecting the rudder pedals to the secondary stops will cause the computer to command a steering

title: At 90 knots, the computer initiates a 0 steering command to …
caption_en: At 90 knots, the computer initiates a 0 steering command to center the nose wheel, after which power is removed from the computer.

title: Two seconds after lift-off, electrical power is restored mom…
caption_en: Two seconds after lift-off, electrical power is restored momentarily to the computer to center the nose wheel again before gear retraction.

title: When the gear control switch is placed UP, the system disarm…
caption_en: When the gear control switch is placed UP, the system disarms and the ON light extinguishes.

title: During approach, the system is automatically re-armed when t…
caption_en: During approach, the system is automatically re-armed when the gear control switch is placed DOWN.

title: After touch-down, when the airplane decelerates to 90 knots,…
caption_en: After touch-down, when the airplane decelerates to 90 knots, electrical power is re-applied to the computer. Note that no steering commands are available until the airplane is below 80 knots.

title: The normal steering rate is about 7sec of nose wheel deflect…
caption_en: The normal steering rate is about 7sec of nose wheel deflection. To make a sharp angle turn on a heavy airplane, depress the Touch Control Steering button while pushing on the rudder pedals. This enables a turn rate of 26sec of nose wheel deflection.

title: If a fault occurs during normal steering operation, the comp…
caption_en: If a fault occurs during normal steering operation, the computer automatically downgrades the system to a degraded mode. This means a lesser steering command with the same rudder pedal deflection.

title: A caution CAS message FAIL will be displayed if the system f…
caption_en: A caution CAS message FAIL will be displayed if the system fails or if the NOSE STEER switch is off.
